text: let's explore the Chao Phraya River the
Chao Phraya River is a great way to get
around Bangkok Bangkok is a chaotic city
but when you get out of the water the
chaos disappears a lot of the top
tourist attractions are located directly
on the river and can be reached by local
water taxis and shuttles the main
tourist stops on the river are the Grand
Palace Chinatown wat po water room and
the flower market hey we finally found
the follow market here in Bangkok
it's very correct flowers are a huge
part of Thailand traditions you'll see
flowers hanging from tuk tuks and
motorbikes they're on display in temples
and shrines and are used as offerings
for festivals and religious ceremonies
and they decorate longtail boats

we have arrived at Wat Arun Wat Arun is
also known as temple of the dawn it's
one of the stops on the river and one of
Bangkok's most recognizable sights with
a 79 meter tower standing proud over the
chao phraya it is a Buddhist temple and
you'll see monks walking the grounds
when you visit be sure to cover your
shoulders and legs whenever visiting a
temple in Thailand
wat PO is also known as temple of the

covered in gold leaf the stop on the
boat is the same stop as the Grand
Palace as they are located beside one
another and it's an easy 10-minute walk
the Grand Palace has been home to the
Thai king and the administrative seat of
government for more than 150 years
it houses the Emerald Buddha but no
photography is allowed inside the temple
it's a beautiful complex to explore and
you cannot miss it when you visit
